text: Hi <@U0260PT3J4T> I usually clone the page that you will be updating first to have a saved version and then you can update the template in page settings and update any content that may have not been brought over.
you can view it without publishing after switching out a template as well!
I've changed my theme name before no issues all of a sudden I change it and the header breaks. Any ideas why? I can't find any dependencies.

To further expound on amy’s response above — HS stores all of the pages content data (modules etc) in a big js object. So what that means is that if you change the strucutre of the page --> OG: DND_area_1 + DND_area_2 ----- new Page: DND_area_1 + DND_side_bar

Only the data/modules that were in DND_area_1 will transfer over to the new page. DND_side_bar will effectively inherit the template default modules or will be blank.

Something to keep in mind when you are building new templates.

Does that make sense?
Totally makes sense! Thank you <@UF6MG8UH1> & <@UQWGKUEN7> :slightly_smiling_face: the launch/switchover went smoothly! :rocket:
